item.title: Self signed certificates
item.description: A quick reminder on how to create self-signed certificates for testing purposes. Generate a private key. openssl genrsa -des3 -out server.key 1024 Create CSR (Certificate Signing Request). openssl req -new -sha256 -key server.key -out server.csr Remove the passphrase (optional). cp server.key server.key.org openssl rsa -in server.key.org -out server.key Generate self-signed certificate openssl x509 -req -days 365 -in server.csr -signkey server.key -out server.crt

item.title: Curlloader on Ubuntu 14.4
item.description: Getting curl-loader source Get the tarball, install some essentials, and unarchive the tar.bz You might have to change the version number accordingly. wget https://sourceforge.net/projects/curl-loader/files/curl-loader-stable/ apt-get install libssl-dev build-essential bunzip2 curl-loader-0.56.tar.bz2 tar xvf curl-loader-0.56.tar make, install Now we can build curl-loader from source. cd curl-loader-0.56 make make install Tune the system Update some system settings as the quick start describes ulimit -n 10000 echo 1 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_tw_reuse Using curl-loader Example Configuration
